--HG--

this approach to adding a view ensures that bookkeeping is all done
(this gets the canvas onto the page properly)

--HG--
branch : sc-editor

update to current sproutcore tip

--HG--
branch : sc-editor

refactoring the editor into model/view/controller SC objects.
Currently, the editor is not displaying properly because the references
that it's picking up are to DOM elements that have been created but are
not actually the ones that are on screen. In Firebug, I'm able to get
the editor to paint by calling createLayer again, grabbing the canvas
node in the console and then plugging that node into the view object.

After that problem is resolved, the next step is rewiring the event
handlers using SproutCore's mechanism.

--HG--

to create an embedded release.

Reimplement scroll bar gutter and nib click behavior
Merge upstream changes
Use BespinScrollerView
moving settings events to the places that they should be, and simplifying settings
loadSession() didn't belong in settings
bizarre init.js had a copy of most of itself appended to the the bottom of the file. deleted
fixing a few issues left over from a half done SC conversion
replacing settings.get( with settings.getValue(, and similar with set so we don't clash with SC.Observable.[gs]et
added comment about being async
s/settings.isOn/settings.isValueOn/g (And same for Off) to avoid confusion. Also adding documentation to settings.
allowing container to init from factory strings to move the dependencies out of container.js
minor tidy ups
Stub in _segmentForMouseEvent
Draw nibs and make scroll bars light up when the mouse is moved over them
Draw knob in the correct position
Put Bespin scrollers in scroller.html; start work on SproutCore-izing scroller events and rendering
Automated merge with file:///Users/pwalton/Source/bespin/local/bespinclient
